meanings.definition: A loud noise caused by the premature ignition of fuel in the engine of a motor vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic heard the backfiring of the car engine.
meanings.sent2: The backfiring of the engine startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The backfiring of the engine made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The backfiring of the engine sounded like a series of small explosions.
meanings.sent5: The backfiring of the engine echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: A plan or action that has the opposite effect of what was intended.
meanings.sent1: The new policy turned out to be a backfiring for the company.
meanings.sent2: The backfiring of the strategy led to unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent3: The backfiring of the plan left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The backfiring of the decision backfired spectacularly.
meanings.sent5: The backfiring of the idea caused more harm than good.

meanings.definition: To have the opposite effect of what was intended.
meanings.sent1: His attempt to impress her ended up backfiring.
meanings.sent2: The prank backfiring on him was quite amusing.
meanings.sent3: The plan backfiring was a lesson in unintended consequences.
meanings.sent4: His words backfiring on him made him regret speaking.
meanings.sent5: The shortcut he took ended up backfiring on his journey.
